instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2838: What is 820-2838? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LCD_BKLT_EN: What is LCD_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “LCD_BKLT” which stands for “LCD screen backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .
definitions.AP_RESET_L: What is AP_RESET_L? AP_RESET_L resets the wifi hardware when it is low, which will keep it from working. AP_RESET_L needs to be high for reset to not be asserted.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..
definitions.PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT is the voltage rail for the backlight of the LCD screen. .
definitions.BKLT_EN: What is BKLT_EN? This signal enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKLT” before “_EN”. “BKLT” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi:
I have a peculiar issue with the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board display working but no backlight due to missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>. On investigating I find that <SIGNAL>PCIE_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is also low.

Apparently the missing signals is what's causing <TRANSISTOR>Q9806</TRANSISTOR> not to turn on although the booster circuit seems to be working fine because shorting 4 & 5 on <TRANSISTOR>Q9806</TRANSISTOR> brings back backlight.

Will appreciate any help on the missing signals.
Regards.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
"I find that <SIGNAL>PCIE_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is also low"
None of PCI-Express devices can work in this case.
Very strange to get image.
You may have corroded/broken trace for <SIGNAL>PCIE_RESET_L</SIGNAL> somewhere.
Check presence of <SIGNAL>AP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PCA9557D_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>AP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PCA9557D_RESET_L</SIGNAL> both are low but not shorted to ground.
Image on internal LCD as well as on external monitor through Mini DP Port!

Everything seems fine except no backlight due to missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>.

please advise.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: The board is not water damaged and traces seem OK under scope. Problem appeared by flickering and dead backlight and after 5 seconds. LCD good and fuse OK.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Remove (one by one) <RESISTOR>R2891</RESISTOR>/93/94/95.
Check if in any moment <SIGNAL>PCI_RESET_L</SIGNAL> goes high.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Removing <RESISTOR>R2891</RESISTOR> (for <SIGNAL>PCA9557D_RESET_L</SIGNAL>) takes the <SIGNAL>PCI_RESET_L</SIGNAL> to 1.4 V.
A. It is normal?
B.  <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> still low.

<RESISTOR>R2891</RESISTOR> removal leads to another problem of why <SIGNAL>PCA9557D_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 0V and pulling down <SIGNAL>PCI_RESET_L</SIGNAL>!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PCI_RESET_L</SIGNAL> should be 3.3V.
Did you remove al the resistors?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Sorry for the delayed response!
yes I did remove all one by one with no change in each step. Voltage on <SIGNAL>PCI_RESET_L</SIGNAL> remains as 1.4-1.55V (of course this measurement is with LCD panel removed, which shouldn't impact <SIGNAL>PCI_RESET_L</SIGNAL>)
Additionally, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_MCP_PLL_HVDD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_MCP_PLL_PEXSATA</SIGNAL> (both going to PCI Express section of <CHIP>U1400</CHIP> are good and 3.3V and 1.05V respectively)

Strangely Mini DP port is outputting image on external monitor despite <SIGNAL>PCI_RESET_L</SIGNAL> being down. 

Help Please.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Looks like MCP issue...

Remove <RESISTOR>R1600</RESISTOR> and check again <SIGNAL>PCI_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Removing <RESISTOR>R1600</RESISTOR> brings it to 3.2V. Replacing <RESISTOR>R1600</RESISTOR> with a fresh one brings it back to 1.9V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Replaced <RESISTOR>R1600</RESISTOR> with 22K as per schematic

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R2891</RESISTOR>/93/94/95. are still disconnected and if I remove <RESISTOR>R1600</RESISTOR> then <SIGNAL>PCI_RESET_L</SIGNAL>. is 3.2V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Something wrong inside MCP.
Check if board works correctly without <RESISTOR>R1600</RESISTOR>, resoldering the other resistors.
If not, try replacing with 100-220K instead of 22K

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Removing <RESISTOR>R1600</RESISTOR> and replacing <RESISTOR>R2891</RESISTOR>/93/94/95 restore <SIGNAL>PCIE_RESET_L</SIGNAL> to 3.2V. 

<SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> is still low. Please advise how to diagnose and get it back to 3.2V...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
So you get image for sure, only missing backlight?
Confirm USB activity and external video...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
I am currently testing the board without SSD and confirm getting the question mark folder on mDP as well as LCD. Replacing <RESISTOR>R1600</RESISTOR> with 200K maintains 3.2V.

Further, removing <RESISTOR>R8910</RESISTOR> (10K) from <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> results in 1.5V and triggers the no-load <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> to 39V.

Will revert on USB and on-load Backlight once I replace the LCD panel as the backlight connector ir broken as hence the no-load test of <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> as 39V.

There seems to be something MYSTERIOUS going on as pull-down resistors to ground on both - the <SIGNAL>PCIE_RESET_L</SIGNAL> as well as <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> screw the signal which otherwise seems to jump back to normal (3.2V) in case of <SIGNAL>PCIE_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and partially (1.5V) in case of <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> with panel connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
39V means LED strip open.
Test another compatible LCD assembly, if LCD connector already changed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: LCD backlight working only with <RESISTOR>R8910</RESISTOR> removed. Changing it from 10K to even 200K doesn?t pull up the backlight enable signal. Will test USB and SD/ SSD and revert.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I can't find <RESISTOR>R8910</RESISTOR> in schematic...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Sorry, it?s 9810. Pull down for <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> before pin 5 of <TRANSISTOR>Q9807</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> comes from MCP too, as <SIGNAL>PCI_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.
Definetely MCP issue then.
Both signals have weak pull-up inside MCP.
Short pins 3/4 of <TRANSISTOR>Q9807</TRANSISTOR> (or leave <RESISTOR>R9810</RESISTOR> out of board) and check if backlight goes off when close the lid.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Removed <RESISTOR>R9810</RESISTOR> to restore <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> and Replaced <RESISTOR>R1600</RESISTOR> with 200K to maintain 3.2V. Subsequently,
1. System booted with SSD
2. Both USB ports worked
3. Backlight sustains at full brightness and <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> measures 24V

As you rightly say, it seems to be a busted driver inside each of the two signals within MCP resulting in weak signal which is hampered by the pull-down resistors.

Seems MCP survives for now!

Thank you so much for your guidance. Presume we can consider this post closed and issues resolved, albeit with a twist in the tale and new ways of reviving dead backlight signals from the MCP!

Cheers!
